sense.name: Pull or strain hard at something without carrying.
sense.examples: The prisoner tugged at the chains. This movie tugs at the heart strings. Each oar was tugged by several men.

sense.name: Strive and make an effort to reach a goal or to prevent something.
sense.examples: We have to tug a little to make the deadline! She is tugging away at her thesis. She tugged and wrestled with her conflicts.

sense.name: Carry with difficulty, perhaps by using a tug boat.
sense.examples: I tugged the freighter into the harbour. You'll have to tug this suitcase up the stairs. The horse finally tugged the cart out of the mud.
